subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Re: for mike E. and other new people
author: bruce halliday
full_text:
--_a685df98-9e6f-4c41-bf82-244826da1306_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


Misty,
 
You are right to a certain extent, I have found in my experience
=
that traditional evp does not lend itself to astral communication.
 
It is =
more for field investigation and capturing grounded spirits.
Personally I f=
eel that each individual is comfortable with their own
style of spirit comm=
unication.  For the new people, The information
I give about box research a=
nd para research in general comes from personal 
of experience.
 
Bruce
Bru=
ce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: bulletbabea@...: =
Wed, 19 Mar 2008 16:14:32 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: for mike E. and other=
 new people




I agree with some of what Bruce said. But dont go throwing =
out everything you have learned about ITC research it STILL applies no matt=
er what method you are using you are building a bridge of contact. I get al=
ot of the same voices coming thru no matter what method I use. There are ma=
ny ways they can manipulate sound whether its using evpmaker, the boxes, wa=
ter, laser, spiricom, etc.As for it being the only live method that is not =
quite true either some of the other methods allow you to hear some of the f=
eedback you get live too (if you can hear them).The basic rule of thumb is =
to remember there are no experts. Try it and see what works best for you an=
d your own hearing.Misty--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday <par=
anormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > mike,> > I'm sorry I was not around wh=
en you started, I guess no one took the time to explain boxes and box resea=
rch to you.> Well here is a crash course!> > I don't know what your experie=
nce is with evp_itc or any other form of spirit communication, but whatever=
 you have learned about capturing and analyzing traditional EVP, has to be =
thrown right out the window. > Box research is a horse of a whole different=
 color. The basic premise for traditional evp capture is that the spirit or=
 entity that is grounded or in visitation at a set location, will manipulat=
e the ambient energy available to it that surrounds the recording medium, b=
e it a digital or analog recorder. It uses this energy, usually thought to =
be EMF energy to place an asimally of a voice onto the recorder. The record=
ing is then uploaded to a computer and is gone over by the researcher/inves=
tigator to search for these little whispered voices on the recording. This =
traditional way of gathering spirit communication serves it's purpose or at=
 least has served it's purpose. > > When you decided to pick up a box, ever=
ything you ever learned about spirit communication ceased to apply. Box com=
munication in a nutshell, no matter what type of box you use is run on the =
same premise. The box or radio is made to sweep the dial fast enough so tha=
t no stable or whole radio signal is captured. The signal is therefore frag=
mented into small bits of sound and fragments of human speech. The idea is =
for our spirit friends to be able to manipulate the fragments of sound to f=
orm intelligible words, phrases and messages that we can understand clearly=
.> > As you know the major factor in the difference between box research an=
d traditional EVP is the fact that you can and most certainly do hear spiri=
t communication through a box live and in real time.> That's what sets this=
 apart from any other paranormal communication research in the world or eve=
n the history of paranormal research.> > The research you are embarking on =
now will take time and patience to become accustomed too but eventually wit=
h experience comes stronger communication, a better relationship between yo=
u and your spirit tech/guides and a better ear for hearing and discerning s=
pirit communication from ordinary radio noise.> > this is just a quick expl=
anation but don't worry anyone here that knows me can tell you there will b=
e much more to come.> > The reason I started this reply was your reference =
to class a EVP, in box research there is no such thing, you either hear it =
or you don't.> > Mike my ears and my mouth are always open so any questions=
, don't hesitate.> > Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To: EVP-ITC@...: f1cracker=
75@...: Tue, 18 Mar 2008 14:42:44 -0700Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] New file uplo=
aded to EVP-ITC> > > > > > Hi Bruce, yeah I am new to the group. 4 weeks no=
w. I have other files loaded, and only load what is closer to class "A" EVP=
. > > I am using the radio shack hack 12-469.> > I record usually in the mo=
rning. I work from home, and wait until the kids and wife are out of the ho=
use, so I have no interruptions.> > My personal interest is to make contact=
 with my family members and friends that have passed on. I have so many que=
stions to ask them, etc....> > Tips are welcome.. I still am playing with t=
he sound of the radio when in scan mode. Trying to get the volume just righ=
t where if i did hear a spirit, the sound of the radio does not drown it ou=
t.> > Any advice you can give me after listening to my files, that would be=
 great!> > Mike Edwards Cary NCbruce halliday <paranormalinvestigating@...>=
 wrote:> > > Hi Mike, I have just returned to this group after a short abse=
nce.My name is Bruce I have exstensive experience with box research and do =
my own research with every type of box that is available including the newe=
st Frank's box that is out.I hear a female response saying "YES" at the ver=
y end of the file. What box are you using? if you can Mike keep your questi=
ons as short and to the point as possible, the longer your speaking the mor=
e chance of stepping on a message or answer.Plus the shorter and more direc=
t the question the easier it will be for them to answer in a reasonable amm=
ount of time. If you don't mind me asking, how long are you involved in box=
 research? I do not remember you the last time I participated here. If you =
have any questions or I can help you with anything just let me know. Bruce>=
 Bruce Halliday > > > From: EVP-ITC@...: EVP-ITC@...: Tue, 18 Mar 2008 18:3=
7:24 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] New file uploaded to EVP-ITC> > > Hello,This e=
mail message is a notification to let you know thata file has been uploaded=
 to the Files area of the EVP-ITC group.File : /Mike Edwards Files/Question=
 to Shay Clark and a voice said yes.wav Uploaded by : f1cracker75 <f1cracke=
r75@...> Description : I asked a deceased friend named Shay Clark if he cou=
ld help me get in touch with my father who died in 1987. I believe I receiv=
ed a yes. Please advise if any of you hear different. The yes is near the e=
nd You can access this file at the URL:http://groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-IT=
C/files/Mike%20Edwards%20Files/Question%20to%20Shay%20Clark%20and%20a%20voi=
ce%20said%20yes.wav To learn more about file sharing for your group, please=
 visit:http://help.yahoo.com/l/us/yahoo/groups/original/members/web/index.h=
tmlfilesRegards,f1cracker75 <f1cracker75@...>> > Connect and share in new w=
ays with Windows Live. Get it now! > > > > Looking for last minute shopping=
 deals? Find them fast with Yahoo! Search. > > > > > > > > ________________=

 Play the word scramble challenge with star power.> http://club.live.com/st=
ar_shuffle.aspx?icid=3Dstarshuffle_wlmailtextlink_jan>

 found in my experience<BR>

tral communication.<BR>

It is more for field investigation and c=
apturing grounded spirits.<BR>
Personally I feel that each individual is co=
mfortable with their own<BR>

ew people, The information<BR>
I give about box research and para research =
in general comes from personal <BR>
of experience.<BR>
